The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at your facility:

Lawson Products, Inc. is committed to worker and public safety in the operation of our McCook distribution center facility. This commitment to safety is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, including, but not limited to Powered Industrial Truck and Spill Response training. An employee safety committee has been established and performs routine checks. Safety is also a topic that is discussed at daily shift start-up meetings. Lawson Products, Inc. maintains a Safety Data Sheet (SDS) listing in the warehouse for use by facility employees. Annual fire safety inspections are performed by Shambaugh & Son, L.P. In addition, Lawson Products, Inc. coordinates emergency response measures with the McCook Fire Department. Lawson Products contracts CNA Insurance for Risk Assessment and underwriting. At least annually, CNA audits the facility with a team of engineers for the main purpose of minimizing potential risk of catastrophic events. Lawson Products utilizes the following: Emergency Response Plan (ERP), Hazardous Communication Program and Process Safety Management (PSM).
Your facility and the regulated substances handled (Facility Description)
Lawson Products, Inc. is an industrial distributor of maintenance and repair supplies, distributing products from our 300,000 square-foot facility in McCook, Illinois. The McCook distribution center consists of administration offices, warehouse storage, and shipping areas. The facility warehouses and distributes approximately 300,000 products under different brand names, some of which are regulated chemical aerosol products. The McCook distribution center operates 5 days a week, 21 hours per day, and employs 150 people.

In addition to our management programs, specially designed systems to control, prevent, detect, and mitigate potential accidental releases are also in place. These include an early suppression, fast response sprinkler system (ESFR) installed throughout the warehouse, to be used in the event of a fire. Aerosol storage racks are equipped with in-rack sprinkler systems and enclosed in the aerosol cage. All of our forklift operators are trained and certified. Water is pumped through the system via an on-site fire pump. The ESFR system is connected to the public water supply system. Our fire pump and sprinkler systems are inspected annually by an outside independent company.

The five-year accident history 

Lawson's McCook facility has no history of accidental releases. Lawson Products, Inc. certifies in the RMP submission to the EPA that during the past five years, no accidental releases have occurred involving regulated flammable substances from the warehousing of aerosol products.

The emergency response program 

Lawson Products, Inc. has an emergency response plan, which details procedures to follow in response to an accidental release and other emergencies. The plan satisfies the requirements for contingency planning and/or notification procedures under the Illinois Toxic Substances Disclosure to Employees Act, OSHA Hazard Communication Standard and Illinois Chemical Safety Act. The Lawson Products, Inc. McCook distribution center meets the National Fire Protection Association Code on the Manufacture and Storage of Aerosol Products (NFPA 30B). This facility has been designed with early suppression fast response (ESFR) sprinkler system to minimize any fire incident. 

In the event of an emergency affecting the local community, Lawson Products, Inc. will work closely with local, county and state agencies to help ensure public safety. These agencies take the lead in informing the public on appropriate actions in the event of an emergency.

Employees of Lawson Products, Inc. McCook DC are trained and instructed to evacuate through the nearest exit in the event of a release, fire or other evacuation. Employees are not responsible for any action required to contain a release or to extinguish a fire

 
Planned changes to improve safety 

Lawson Products, Inc. strives for continuous improvement in its safety program. We train our employees to safely perform their assigned tasks. We encourage employees to suggest changes or improvements that will help minimize the potential for unanticipated failure of operating equipment including forklift trucks. Our systems and programs are routinely audited, typically by an outside company or insurance carrier to evaluate their effectiveness.

The palletized loads are stored within an isolated NFPA aerosol cage with ESFR fire protection. There is a 24/7 security system and a 24/7 fire monitoring system monitoring the facility for a potential event. Security personnel are present at all times on days of operation.

Some aerosol products stored in the McCook facility contain blends of flammable propellants, which are regulated under the RMP Rule if handled, manufactured or stored in a process at a facility in a quantity greater than its listed threshold quantity. The specified threshold quantity for flammable substances under the RMP Rule is 10,000 pounds. The warehouse facility constitutes a single process. The warehouse stores greater than 10,000 pounds of butane and propane in aerosol products. 

The aerosol products are typically in metal containers, with the maximum size of 24-ounces. The average weight of these aerosol products is 17.28 oz and the average amount of propellant in each can is 14%. Per EPA Helpline, the worst case scenario was clarified as the release of the largest quantity of a regulated substance from a single aerosol can.  The worst case scenario was based on an event consisting of one 18 oz aerosol can containing 15% of propane and 15% of butane. The quantity released in a vapor cloud explosion would not affect any residential population or public receptor or have any off-site consequences. 

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps 

Lawson's McCook facility is subject to OSHA's PSM rule. Lawson Products, Inc. is an ISO 9001:2015 certified company, and internal and external audits are performed regularly.
